data.title: Tiny bug in ExplosionData::packData(): Number of used time keys counted incorrectly. (1 word fix)
GFX initialize resolution
data.body:
Why under _GFXInitGetInitialRes is kDefaultWindowSizeX and Y not set to the passed in initialSize.

We made this change in our personal build and I was thinking about uploading it to here, but just wondering if there was some reasoning behind it. We use it to you can have multiple views (TSControls) and still have stuff work properly.

This seems like a bug and I would be willing to upload the two line change, but wanted to know more about the original reasoning if anyone knew. Or to make sure it really was a bug and not an odd feature.

data.title: Splash screen fix

data.body:
Fixes the window creation and splash screen behavior to behave as intended.

The splash screen will be displayed, and will stay displayed without the window being created until the engine and GUI initialization is complete. 

This prevents the blank window from displaying as the engine starts up and overall looks better.

data.title: Port existing unit tests to googletest

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
This will also involve some pruning and re-evaluation of the current test suite. Also, I will not port any tests that don't pass or don't test anything useful. The current [default construction](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/unit/tests/testDefaultConstruction.cpp) test of console classes is a good example of a useless test, because _not_ all console classes actually instantiate without datablocks, for example, so it's not really something we want to assert is always true.

The tests will also be moved. Unit tests should all live in a `test/` directory adjacent to the source files they test (or a reasonable location if a large system must be tested that is spread over multiple directories... though I don't think we really have any of these). Test files will be named after the source file they test with the `Test` suffix, or something reasonable if the functionality they test really is split over multiple files. For example, `Vector`, which is declared in `tVector.h` is tested by `test/tVectorTest.cpp`. `Profiler`, which is declared in `profiler.h`, is tested in `test/profilerTest.cpp`.

The contents of all test files will be wrapped in `#ifdef TORQUE_TESTS_ENABLED`.

Stress tests (i.e. tests which don't test for the correctness of a specific API, just try to do lots of work in hopes of breaking something) should be named `TEST(Whatever, StressSomething)` (i.e. with a `Stress` prefix to their test case name) so they can be selectively excluded.

As a policy, interactive tests are being removed. Nobody's going to bother to run them - the unit tests should focus on things that can run automatically.
## [Working branch](https://github.com/eightyeight/Torque3D/compare/gtest-tests)
- [x] Make GCC happy
- [x] Add CMake support (6cc59a9)
- [x] Remove existing unit test framework (1a5664c)
- [x] Add a `main.cs` replacement that runs tests (e5bb218, e5bb218)
- [x] Port component tests (21ecb6f)
- [x] Port `Vector` tests (b480502, dbc0dff)
- [x] Port `PlaneF` tests (2c2284e, c0851e9)
- [x] Port matrix multiplication implementation test (7b18431)
- [x] Port `RuntimeClassRep` test (523adea)
- [x] Port swizzle test (2f2d7cf)
- [x] Port threading tests (2f95583, 9601162, fb408f3, 4c76962, 93325df, b34afee)
- [x] Port string tests (3cdfcb1)
- [x] Port path tests (18c5c25)
- [x] Port file tests (b34b1a7)
- [x] Port journal and process tests (5c6d22a)
- [x] Port fixed size deque tests (552cb87)
- [x] Port window manager tests (fbd97b0)
- [x] Port time manager test (eeac48b)
- [x] Port network tests (77381ac, e6d47c5)
- [x] Port basic types test (b43b6d2)
- [x] Optimistically add profiler test so we can think about stopping it from leaking (56d4341)
- [x] Remove or quarantine tests with effects or stress tests, since they won't always be appropriate (867997f, 85a0c1c)
  - [x] Remove alert dialog box test (262a08b)
  - [x] Don't run stress tests by default
  - [x] Remove unused interactive GFX tests (225ef8a)
- [x] Ensure all tests pass, either by removing them or actually fixing bugs (in the code or the tests)
  - [x] Remove default instantiation test as it doesn't test anything we can measure (0a8eb6f)
  - [x] `simComponentTest.cpp` line 135
  - [x] `threadSafeRefCountTest.cpp` line 126
  - [x] `threadSafeRefCountTest.cpp` line 151
  - [x] `platformTimeTest.cpp` line 43
  - [x] Thread static tests (see #760)
- [x] Comment out tests that I don't have time to port
  - [x] Zip tests (178484c, #798)
  - [x] Async packet queue test (b173e55, #799)

data.title: Sahara

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: This is the inclusion of the material accumalator called Sahara from BitGap games. Konrad Kiss has given us permission to realease this under MIT.

data.title: Mounted PointLight's selection sphere does not go away
data.body:
In the Full template, place a Cheetah n the world editor and select one of its mounted `PointLight` tail-lights. De-select it, and the selection sphere will remain around the light, even after closing and re-opening the editor.

![cheetah](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/904269/3550588/ce8629a4-08da-11e4-942c-e9e817a0d904.png)

Win7 x64, latest development head.

data.title: Gui3DProjectionControl
data.body: [This](https://www.garagegames.com/community/resources/view/12055) seems like a good thing to include in stock T3D. Need to resolve some questions about functionality, like what if it's attached to a ghost that goes out of scope?

data.title: Fix to allow parallax mapping with dxtnm textures via the red channel.
data.body:
Currently the only option in T3D to use compressed normal maps with parallax is DXT3. This allows allows the use of height in the red channel of a dxt5nm.

A test texture set is here http://narivtech.com/downloads/textures_normal.zip

data.body: Currently, `NavPath`'s `alwaysRender` flag only works in the editor, which is kind of annoying. This makes it work in the same way as `NavMesh`'s flag, which lets you view it outside the editor.
